Author: linux-security@amazon.com
Title: Amazon Linux 2 2017.12 - ALAS2-2020-1438: medium priority package update for wireshark
Description:
Package updates are available for Amazon Linux 2 that fix the following vulnerabilities:
CVE-2018-7418:
	In Wireshark 2.2.0 to 2.2.12 and 2.4.0 to 2.4.4, the SIGCOMP dissector could crash. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-sigcomp.c by correcting the extraction of the length value.
1549305: CVE-2018-7418 wireshark: SIGCOMP dissector crash in packet-sigcomp.c

CVE-2018-19622:
	In Wireshark 2.6.0 to 2.6.4 and 2.4.0 to 2.4.10, the MMSE dissector could go into an infinite loop. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-mmse.c by preventing length overflows.
1655932: CVE-2018-19622 wireshark: Infinite loop in the MMSE dissector

CVE-2018-16057:
	In Wireshark 2.6.0 to 2.6.2, 2.4.0 to 2.4.8, and 2.2.0 to 2.2.16, the Radiotap dissector could crash. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-ieee80211-radiotap-iter.c by validating iterator operations.
1625925: CVE-2018-16057 wireshark: Radiotap dissector crash

CVE-2018-14368:
	In Wireshark 2.6.0 to 2.6.1, 2.4.0 to 2.4.7, and 2.2.0 to 2.2.15, the Bazaar protocol dissector could go into an infinite loop. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-bzr.c by properly handling items that are too long.
1607327: CVE-2018-14368 wireshark: Bazaar dissector infinite loop (wnpa-sec-2018-40)

CVE-2018-14341:
	In Wireshark 2.6.0 to 2.6.1, 2.4.0 to 2.4.7, and 2.2.0 to 2.2.15, the DICOM dissector could go into a large or infinite loop. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-dcm.c by preventing an offset overflow.
1607326: CVE-2018-14341 wireshark: DICOM dissector infinite loop (wnpa-sec-2018-39)

CVE-2018-14340:
	In Wireshark 2.6.0 to 2.6.1, 2.4.0 to 2.4.7, and 2.2.0 to 2.2.15, dissectors that support zlib decompression could crash. This was addressed in epan/tvbuff_zlib.c by rejecting negative lengths to avoid a buffer over-read.
1607323: CVE-2018-14340 wireshark: Multiple dissectors could crash (wnpa-sec-2018-36)

CVE-2018-11362:
	In Wireshark 2.6.0, 2.4.0 to 2.4.6, and 2.2.0 to 2.2.14, the LDSS dissector could crash. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-ldss.c by avoiding a buffer over-read upon encountering a missing '\0' character.
1581787: CVE-2018-11362 wireshark: Out-of-bounds read in packet-ldss.c
